intro: Lychnis segetum, commonly known as the field sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and typically grows in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. The plant features erect stems with opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink or red, arranged in clusters at the top of the stem, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Lychnis segetum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
